column1: Heverlee (Dutch: [ˈɦeːvərleː]) is a town in Belgium. It is a borough of the city of Leuven. Heverlee is bordered by Herent
column3: Oud Heverlee and several other municipalities that are part of Leuven (including Leuven proper and Kessel-Lo).

column1: The town is the location of the Heverlee War Cemetery for Commonwealth casualties from the Second World War.

The town also harbours a significant part of the university campus of the Katholieke Universiteit Leuven. The Arenberg campus is the main area for research and educational facilities for exact sciences (The Science
column2: Engineering and Technology Group). These contain the Faculty of Engineering (see Arenberg Château)
column3: the Faculty of Bioscience Engineering and the Faculty of Science. A part of the Biomedical Group
column4: namely the Faculty of Kinesiology and Rehabilitation Sciences also has its main facilities on the campus.

column1: The Katholieke Hogeschool Leuven is another higher education facility with some facilities in Heverlee. It lies next to the Heilig Hart-Instituut
column2: which is a school for secondary education. Also
column4: Heverlee is situated outside the centre.

column1: Also situated in Heverlee is the Den Dreef stadium
column2: home of the Belgian 2nd Division football team Oud-Heverlee Leuven.

column1: The Cyclocross Leuven is a cyclo-cross race held in January.
